quest.name: A Seat at the Last Stand
journal: Alisaie appears in desperate need of a study break.
objectives: Speak with Last Stand customers while accompanied by Alisaie.
Speak with Dickon while accompanied by Alisaie.
Place the correct dish on the first customer's table.
Place the correct dish on the second customer's table.
Place the correct dish on the third customer's table.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Ready for a tea break, Forename? I know I am.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Honestly, my neck and shoulders are going to calcify if I don't stretch my legs and walk around for a bit...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: You know the Last Stand down in the harbor, don't you? Come and meet me near the outside tables, and I'll treat you to their coffee. It's quite good!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: As busy as ever, I see. How very Sharlayan that no other gourmet café has sprung up to compete for customers...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Actually, this crowd gives me an idea: before we place an order, why don't we ask a few questions and gauge the mood of the city?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I'm interested to hear what the average citizen has to say about the Telophoroi. We might even learn something new. Worth a try, don't you think?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Alisaie is now accompanying you. Keep her at your side in order to proceed with quest objectives.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You can leave Alisaie behind by entering a different area, or by speaking with her and selecting the option to part ways.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: If you wish to have Alisaie accompany you again, return and speak with her at the original location.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Talk.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Part ways.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Nothing.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Someone here at the café should be willing to speak with us. Let's ask around!

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: Are you sure you wish to part ways with Alisaie?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: No rest for a hero, eh? Do what you must. I'll wait for you at the Last Stand.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Right. Ready to pick up from where we left off?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Alisaie has yet to arrive. Be sure she is at your side before attempting to continue.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Alisaie wishes to hear what the citizens have to say. Bring her with you before attempting to engage them in conversation.

dialogue.name: HILDOISE
dialogue.text: Yes? I don't believe I've had the pleasure...?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Pray excuse the interruption, but we were hoping you might share your thoughts on the Telophoroi and their unconscionable plans...

dialogue.name: HILDOISE
dialogue.text: My goodness, if it isn't the young Miss Leveilleur.

dialogue.name: HILDOISE
dialogue.text: My apologies, but I work in the offices of the Forum, and if word reached Master Fourchenault that I was helping you...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I see... We're sorry to have bothered you.

dialogue.name: HILDOISE
dialogue.text: I do not wish to give offense, but your companion is a well-known figure in the city, and you never know who might be watching...

dialogue.name: PIRONDIERRE
dialogue.text: What, what─what is it? Can a man not enjoy a moment of private respite? If you're looking to share a table, then I respectfully request that you look elsewhere.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: You misunderstand, sir─we were simply wondering if you knew of the Telophoroi. These enemies of peace have promised an end to all we hold dear, and─

dialogue.name: PIRONDIERRE
dialogue.text: Wait. You're that House Leveilleur girl, aren't you?

dialogue.name: PIRONDIERRE
dialogue.text: And this womanman with you is obviously a foreigner. Hmph. I'd heard you were disowned for helping outsiders indulge their barbaric whims, and here you are giving truth to the rumor...

dialogue.name: PIRONDIERRE
dialogue.text: I'll thank you to leave me be. I've naught to say to the likes of you.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Well! I must apologize. 'Twas foolish of me to expect an onze of civility from one so enlightened. Come, Forename.

dialogue.name: PIRONDIERRE
dialogue.text: Did I not make myself clear? Away with you, and let me dine in peace.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Well, the customers have been decidedly uncooperative. Maybe the staff would be more willing to answer our questions.

dialogue.name: DICKON
dialogue.text: Welcome, madamsir! What can I offer you today?

dialogue.name: DICKON
dialogue.text: Wait, is that Mistress Alisaie I see there!? My word, how long has it been!?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Far too long...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Meet Dickon, the owner of the Last Stand. I used to frequent his café on occasion, in between lessons at the Studium.

dialogue.name: DICKON
dialogue.text: That seems like an age ago now. I remember hearing that you and Master Alphinaud had set sail for Eorzea, but then you never came back.

dialogue.name: DICKON
dialogue.text: Lately there's been gossip about your father disowning the pair of you. Everything all right at home?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: It's...complicated. And I hadn't expected complete strangers to be so familiar with our situation quite so quickly. Everyone has an opinion, it seems...

dialogue.name: DICKON
dialogue.text: Well, it is House Leveilleur. No matter how discreet Master Fourchenault may have been, news of your family's doings never stays secret for long.

dialogue.name: DICKON
dialogue.text: Things being what they are, what brings you back to the city now, of all times?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: We have questions, and only Sharlayan has the answers. Tell me, Master Dickon: have you heard anything about an apocalypse called the Final Days?

dialogue.name: DICKON
dialogue.text: What, like the end of the world? Nothing like that, I'm afraid. And that's what you're here to find? Information on this...apocalypse?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Yes, whatever we can learn. Unfortunately, your patrons appear to be unwilling to speak with me.

dialogue.name: DICKON
dialogue.text: I wish there was more I could do to help...

dialogue.name: DICKON
dialogue.text: Hm, but maybe there is. You're a visitor to Sharlayan, aren't you?

dialogue.name: DICKON
dialogue.text: Then few will know your face. We should be able to pass you off as a server with none the wiser.

dialogue.name: DICKON
dialogue.text: We just finished preparing a few orders. Strike up some friendly conversation while you're setting down the food, and you might just get the answers you're looking for.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Not a bad idea. I hate to ask, but...what do you think?

dialogue.name: DICKON
dialogue.text: That's the spirit! Pay attention, now, and I'll explain where each of these dishes needs to go.

dialogue.name: DICKON
dialogue.text: The tea set is for the chatty group sitting by the water's edge.

dialogue.name: DICKON
dialogue.text: The omelette is for one of our regulars─a Highlander by the name of Gisla. She's sitting at an outside table with a friend of hers.

dialogue.name: DICKON
dialogue.text: Behind them, you should see a Miqo'te gentleman. He ordered the oven-baked lobster.

dialogue.name: DICKON
dialogue.text: Got all that? If you're not sure, just ask and I'll explain again. Good luck!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I think you'll be better off if I stay here, out of sight. Find out what you can, and there'll be a hot cup of coffee waiting for you.

dialogue.name: DICKON
dialogue.text: Any troubles? Remember: the tea set goes to the group by the water.

dialogue.name: DICKON
dialogue.text: The omelette is for Gisla, a Highlander woman sitting outside with her friend.

dialogue.name: DICKON
dialogue.text: Last but not least, our famous lobster goes to the Miqo'te man seated directly behind those two ladies.

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: What will you serve?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: The tea set.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: The omelette.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: The oven-baked lobster.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Cancel.

dialogue.name: Q4
dialogue.text: Clear away the dish?

dialogue.name: HERMENJART
dialogue.text: Oh, my tea set! Lovely, thank you!

dialogue.name: HERMENJART
dialogue.text: ...The Telopho-who? I'm sorry, I've never heard of them, or their “final days.”

dialogue.name: HERMENJART
dialogue.text: My friends and I are somewhat uninformed when it comes to current events. Now, if you wanted to hear about ritual arcane practices of the Sixth Astral Era─common or esoteric─then I'd be happy to talk your ear off...

dialogue.name: HERMENJART
dialogue.text: Excuse me, I didn't order this! Where is my tea set?

dialogue.name: HERMENJART
dialogue.text: You work here, don't you? I'm still waiting on that charming little tea set...

dialogue.name: HERMENJART
dialogue.text: Ahem, I only ordered the tea set. I can't possibly eat this as well, so if you would be so kind...?

dialogue.name: HERMENJART
dialogue.text: I always like to order this when I'm discussing arcane theory with my peers. It's my favorite treat!

dialogue.name: Q5
dialogue.text: What will you serve?

dialogue.name: A5
dialogue.text: The omelette.

dialogue.name: A5
dialogue.text: The oven-baked lobster.

dialogue.name: A5
dialogue.text: Cancel.

dialogue.name: GISLA
dialogue.text:
Ah, finally! Two, four, six, eight!♪
Let's dig in─no time to waste─♪

dialogue.name: GISLA
dialogue.text: What? The Telophoroi? Ah, yes! I remember seeing the name in the latest gazette.

dialogue.name: GISLA
dialogue.text: That and some grand claim about the end of days. Same old senseless warmongering. When will these fools grow tired of spilling each other's blood?

dialogue.name: GISLA
dialogue.text: Best stay out of it, I say. The Forum made the right choice, and I fully support our decision to remain neutral!

dialogue.name: GISLA
dialogue.text: Is this on the house? Because I'm not paying for oven-baked lobster I didn't order. Now, where is my omelette?

dialogue.name: GISLA
dialogue.text: Gods above, I'm starving! I've never known the service to be this slow...

dialogue.name: GISLA
dialogue.text: I know I didn't order this, but I'm beginning to wish I had. It smells divine...

dialogue.name: GISLA
dialogue.text: The Last Stand really does make the best omelettes in the world. The fluffiest egg. The tartest sauce. I could eat it every day for a year!

dialogue.name: Q6
dialogue.text: What will you serve?

dialogue.name: A6
dialogue.text: The oven-baked lobster.

dialogue.name: A6
dialogue.text: Urbane banter with a smile.

dialogue.name: A6
dialogue.text: Cancel.

dialogue.name: SMITUTIA
dialogue.text: At last, the oven-baked lobster is mine! You have no idea how long I've scrimped and saved and suffered to afford this heavenly dish...

dialogue.name: SMITUTIA
dialogue.text: The Final Days? This is the first I've heard of it.

dialogue.name: SMITUTIA
dialogue.text: Although, that would explain why my friend has been rushed off his feet. It must be a busy time to be a gleaner.

dialogue.name: SMITUTIA
dialogue.text: Hm? You don't know what a gleaner is? They're...collectors, of a sort. Travel the world procuring things that we haven't got here in Sharlayan─priceless books, unusual live specimens, and so forth.

dialogue.name: SMITUTIA
dialogue.text: So named for those folk who trail after the reapers in the fields, picking up every grain which was missed. Aye, by all accounts, gleaning is a most meticulous and demanding profession.

dialogue.name: SMITUTIA
dialogue.text: If these Telophoroi make good on their audacious threats, then many uncatalogued rarities could be lost forever. Why else would the gleaners be buzzing about in such a frenzy?

dialogue.name: SMITUTIA
dialogue.text: Watch the harbor, and you'll see what I mean─they're carting loads in from the docks all day. It's never been this hectic before. Not like this.

dialogue.name: SMITUTIA
dialogue.text: Er, you don't need to butter me up, you know... I've already ordered one of the most expensive things on the menu.

dialogue.name: SMITUTIA
dialogue.text: Gods, the anticipation... I've heard it melts in your mouth like the most succulent roast ever made!

dialogue.name: SMITUTIA
dialogue.text: I've wanted to try this meal ever since I saw it served at another table. Ah, the aroma alone was worth every gil I scraped together!

dialogue.name: DICKON
dialogue.text: I hope you and Mistress Alisaie got what you needed! ...She must be fond of you, eh? I've never known her to bring anyone to the café before.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Any trouble with the customers? Were you able to get anyone talking?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Interesting... They seem unaware of the Final Days, aside from whatever vague news the gazettes are printing.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Even Dickon had nothing to offer, and he's the best source of gossip in the city. Hmmm... If the Forum does have secret knowledge, then they've done an impressive job of ensuring no one whispers it in the wrong ear.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: In any case, thank you for playing the part so well! Here─that cup of coffee I promised.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: But let's enjoy our drinks somewhere else, shall we? Maybe behind the peristyle, away from the gossips and their wagging tongues...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Yes, this should do nicely. Out of the wind, and out of sight.
